title: Bug 10403 - Project creation should confirm the bin directory can be scrubbed
OB: When a user creates a new project for an existing directory structure, we should confirm that the output directory can be deleted then rebuilt. Some users are creating projects and pointing the output folder at a bin directory which contains more than just .class files that can be rebuilt from the available .java files.
EB: When creating a new project, there should be a confirmation that the bin directory is deletable and can be rebuilt.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps: 
1. Create a new project for an existing directory structure. 
2. Set the output folder to a bin directory that contains files other than .class files. 
3. Check if there is a confirmation message ensuring that the bin directory can be deleted and rebuilt.
